creator: Plato (Πλάτων)
description:
LibriVox recording of Statesman by Plato (Πλάτων). (Translated by Benjamin Jowett.)
Read in English by Geoffrey Edwards
Statesman (Ancient Greek: Πολιτικός) discusses God's role in maintaining the universe and describes the statesman as a good shepherd who promotes intermarriage between the orderly and courageous. (Summary by Geoffrey Edwards)
For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording.

For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org.

M4B Format Available
subject: librivox; audiobooks;politics; God; ethics; plato; virtue
title: Statesman
